solution_line_template: In a week, her birds eat a total of {parrot_weekly_consumption} grams + {cockatiel_weekly_consumption} grams = <<{parrot_weekly_consumption}+{cockatiel_weekly_consumption}={total_weekly_consumption}>>{total_weekly_consumption} grams of seed each week.
Leah has a total of {boxes_bought} + {boxes_already_had} = <<{boxes_bought}+{boxes_already_had}={total_boxes}>>{total_boxes} boxes of birdseed.
The boxes of birdseed contain a total of {total_boxes} * {grams_per_box} grams = <<{total_boxes}*{grams_per_box}={total_grams_of_seed}>>{total_grams_of_seed} grams.
This is enough birdseed to feed her pets for {total_grams_of_seed} / {total_weekly_consumption} = <<{total_grams_of_seed}/{total_weekly_consumption}={weeks_of_feed}>>{weeks_of_feed} weeks.
